alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 26 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: .Heavy rainfall continues to move inland from the Gulf of Maine waters over Eastern Maine and will track northward this evening. Deep tropical moisture combined with strong upper level dynamics will support heavy rainfall. Small rivers, streams and creeks are swollen and with grounds soaked, will result in significant runoff through this evening. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, and Far Northern Maine, including the following areas, in Central Highlands Maine, Northern Penobscot. In Far Eastern Maine, Southeast Aroostook. In Far Northern Maine, Northeast Aroostook. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall of one to two inches with locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook
